headline: Comcast shares plunge on anticipated broadband subscriber loss
summary: Comcast (CMCSA) shares are under pressure after the company sounded the alarm of higher broadband subscriber loss in the fourth quarter. The decline represents the stock's largest intraday decline since April 25. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: Comcast and T-Mobile Forecasts Sink Telecom Stocks. Here’s What’s Happening.
summary: The chief executives of  Comcast  and  T-Mobile  cautioned investors about their fourth-quarter results, triggering slides in their own stocks and shares of other broadband-service providers.  Shares of  Comcast  plunged 9.2% to $39.16, making the stock the worst performer in the  index as of Monday afternoon, according to Dow Jones Market Data.  CEO David Watson said the company was on track to lose more than 100,000 broadband subscribers in the fourth quarter.

CEO David Watson said the company was on track to lose more than 100,000 broadband subscribers in the fourth quarter.

headline: Why Comcast (CMCSA) Stock Is Nosediving
summary: Shares of telecommunications and media company Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA) fell 7.5% in the morning session after CEO Dave Watson told investors the company expects to lose over 100,000 broadband subscribers in the fourth quarter. This figure exceeds analysts' predictions of roughly 64,000. Watson blamed the weaker forecast partly on bad weather, which he said caused about 10,000 of the expected cancellations.

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery, SoFi, PayPal: 3 Trending Tickers
summary: Wealth host Brad Smith examines three of this morning's top trending stocks: Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) reaches a multi-year renewal deal with Comcast (CMCSA) to bundle the media giant's top channels to Comcast subscribers. SoFi Technologies (SOFI) gets a downgrade to Outperform by Bank of America analysts. On the other hand, BofA analysts upgraded PayPal (PYPL) to a Buy rating on the company's growth potential. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: Comcast warns of higher broadband losses on tough competition, hurricane hit
summary: Its dour forecast also dragged down smaller rival Charter Communications' stock by 6.5%.  Comcast expects broadband subscriber losses to be a little over 100,000 in the last three months of 2024, Dave Watson, president and CEO of Comcast Cable, said at the UBS Global Media and Communications conference.  Comcast said about 10,000 broadband losses are tied to Hurricanes Milton and Helene that made landfall in Florida within two weeks of each other, disrupting businesses.

Comcast said about 10,000 broadband losses are tied to Hurricanes Milton and Helene that made landfall in Florida within two weeks of each other, disrupting businesses.

headline: Comcast, Warner Bros Discovery enter multi-year distribution deal
summary: (Reuters) -Warner Bros Discovery signed a multi-year deal with Comcast that lays the groundwork for the European launch of the Max streaming service, and resolves a dispute over a coming "Harry Potter" TV series, the companies said on Monday.  Under the wide-ranging agreement, Warner Bros Discovery's portfolio of TV networks, including TNT, CNN, and Food Network, will be available to subscribers of Comcast's Xfinity service in the U.S. and Sky in Britain and Ireland.  The deal came as Comcast warned of higher-than-expected broadband losses, sending its shares down 8.4%.

The deal came as Comcast warned of higher-than-expected broadband losses, sending its shares down 8.4%.

headline: Comcast and Warner Bros. Discovery Announce Multi-Year Distribution Agreements Across Xfinity and Sky UK
summary: PHILADELPHIA & NEW YORK, December 09, 2024--Comcast (NASDAQ: CMCSA) and Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. (NASDAQ: WBD) today announced long-term agreements that will deliver WBD’s extensive portfolio of content to Xfinity and Sky UK and Ireland customers using Comcast’s global technology platform across linear television, apps, and streaming services.
